item.name: Area Under Payment For Enviromental Services/Incentive System
item.label: Area Under Payment For Enviromental Services/Incentive System

item.name: Emergency Supplies (Distribution)? (Food, Medical Items, Emergency Equipment...)
item.label: Emergency Supplies (Distribution)? (Food, Medical Items, Emergency Equipment...)

input.label: Unique-ID
input.hint: For new locations, this column will be empty. For updates, your KfW counterpart will provide you with the list of unique_id numbers in this file to ensure that updated location ids match with the former ones.

input.label: KfW Project -No. (INPRO)
input.hint: This is the KfW internal Project Number which has to be provided by your KfW counterpart

input.label: Abbreviation of project name (project acronym)
input.hint: Please enter here the acronym used for the name/title of the project (e.g. HREII) to be visible on your map. If the project has multiple phases, please add the number of the phase belonging to the before-stated KfW Project-No.

input.label: Data Owner (Institution Name)
input.hint: Legal Entity who owns the data provided here (= legal authorship)

select1.label: Publishing restrictions due to security reasons
select1.hint: Indicates if this information is collected in fragile regions (e.g. areas of severe civil conflict or war) and should therefore be ommited from publicly available reports.

input.label: Date of data collection or latest update
input.hint: Date of data collection or latest update (if date of data collection is unknown). In case only the year is available please choose the 1st of january e.g. 2022-01-01

input.label: Project-specific location identifier
input.hint: In case the location or activity has a project-specific identifier (e.g., a location code in the MIS of the source Agency) or an identifier in a public database, it can be entered here.

input.label: Location name
input.hint: Name of the location if existing, e.g. Al Sharifa School

select1.label: Location Activity Status
select1.hint: The location activity status according to the IATI standard. If you are unaware of the current status please choose "NA"

input.label: Planned or actual start date of activity at the location
input.hint: Approximated planned or actual start date of implementation of activities on the ground. This can be e.g. the date when construction work is planned to begin. For no information enter 2100-01-01

input.label: Planned or actual end date of activity at the location
input.hint: Approximated planned or actual end date of activities on the ground. This can be e.g. the date when the project is planned to cease implementation activities. For no information enter 2100-01-01

input.label: Activity-Description (general)
input.hint: A short description of the main project activity in this location, e.g., hydropower plant construction or construction of small irrigation systems.

input.label: Additional Activity-Description
input.hint: Free text (In case you need to add other location–specific information like production volumes, progress values or a tag like "COVID-19"). Please consult your KfW counterpart if additional information is required.

select1.label: KC Theme / Sub-Sector
select1.hint: Sectoral / cross-sectoral location type preselection field, see table sheets "Location Types" & KC Themes. If there is no fit, select "other physical/immaterial and fill out the column "Alternative Location Type".

select1.label: Location Type Name
select1.hint: After selecting the KC Theme, choose the most appropriate location type, see table sheet "Location Types". If there is no fit please select "other phys./imm." and fill out the next column "Alternative Location Type".

input.label: Alternative Location Type Name
input.hint: If you selected "other physical or other immaterial " in Location Type Name, please propose your own location type here. This will help us to propose a comprehensive IATI standard extension in the future.

input.label: DAC 5 Purpose Classification
input.hint: Assignment to the respective DAC5/CRS codes, see table sheet "DAC Purpose Codes".

input.label: Budget share of this location in €.
input.hint: The budget share allocated to this location in €. The sum of all locations in a project should add up to the budget sum in Inpro/PMT including overheads. Data from private partners/PEA must not be entered here!

select1.label: Geographic Exactness
select1.hint: Use "exact", if you know the geographically exact end destination of a financial flow & it is not an administrative unit & if you don't face security restrictions to do so. If not, use the resp. type "approximate".

input.label: Latitude
input.hint: Enter the Latitude measured with a GPS device (or centroid for approximate locations). Make sure to use WGS 84 as the Coordinate Reference System (EPSG:4326). Enter Values with at least FIVE digits.

input.label: Longitude
input.hint: Enter the Longitude measured with a GPS device (or centroid for approximate locations) here. Make sure to use WGS 84 as the Coordinate Reference System (EPSG:4326). Enter Values with at least FIVE digits.

input.label: Related Community / Village / Neighborhood
input.hint: Is there a village name that relates to this project. This can serve as well to manually add smaller locations resp. administrative unit names not identified in global coordinates lists such as GADM.

upload.label: Filename of additional Geo-data submitted as KML (Lines/Polygons)
upload.hint: A string of the KML file where the associated geometry information is found. Note, to link an entry from this excel to the KML file, it is required to correctly fill in the Primary Key column.

input.label: Primary Key (as provided in KML file)
input.hint: Required only in case you provide additonal geolocation information in another KML file. The geometry in the KML file should possess the same primary key as an attribute as it is listed here.
